text: good morning modern stutters it's a balmy 19 degrees out this morning gotta love winter speaking of winter we need to prep our chicken coop for winter let's get that finished this morning I'm gonna go over to one of the tents and pick out the chicken wire believe and hope I have a roll of chicken wire in here yes I do I'm not super worried about keeping critters out of this part of the chicken run this will be the chicken run except they'll be in here during the day so I'm not too concerned about predators during the day accreta me locked up at night in New York City that's predator proof so what I want to do today is make it so the chickens stay in and they can't get out fourme up here in northern New Hampshire the winter chicken coop is more about function how do we get the coop to function well and do what we needed to do throughout the winter where we don't have to spend a lot of the money run electricity for heat lives and further water is how do we get the chickens to thrive in the normal conditions without having to baby them we don't want to have to do that here [Applause] I found the tarps that cover lumber piles at the lumber yard where they last a while so they have a white site and a black side so depending on what purpose you use it for you might want to have different sides out and so for our one of our shooting tractors that the chickens are in the summertime we have the white reflect the Sun this being a winter chicken coop I'm going to put the black out so it attracts the Sun it should help heat up the green [Applause] [Music] oh that's my mistake I thought this tarp was 16 feet long only a 12-footer man oh well I'll use it for now [Applause] [Music] well that's definitely a disappointment I thought all the tops I had were 16 feet long I'm going to go buy two new ones now one for the chicken coop and one for the pigs not doing that today we don't have time for that but let's let the chickens out feed them let's go give the pig some more hay it's gonna be fun I bet who else is gonna like this hot water outdoors Beckett it's going to be all the animals this winter they'll be able to have hot water to drink [Applause] I like putting the grain right down topper where I want the animals to scratch check through and eat we want to start turning all this hay for us so it's why we're feeding them right here we want to encourage that kind of behavior in our animals I'm hoping this keeps them in if it does we can bring the Icelandic chickens in over to the winter chicken coop I bet they'll love being able to be the bigger flock and stay warmer when it gets colder Oh mr. Biggs you quiet this morning oh it's Andy going after you how's the warm water let's go give the pig some water then we'll bring up over some fresh hay [Music] they're still sleeping now coming out to this site is never gonna get old good morning girls buried in that hay staying warm you know bring in see if we can show you a pursuit oh she's in there somewhere oh there's the other schnauzer good morning come on and there you are oh you look like happy pigs you know once a nice warm water yeah then I'll bring you some more hey took me a second to find their dish I was hoping it wasn't back in the tote all right Copa it's just a nice warm water out here for them they're a lot more friendly now not coppa getting to know us already don't worry prosciutto you don't need to get up I'm gonna go get the hey stay here and keep an eye on the pigs for me blowing bubbles over there you can eat it you can play in it whatever you want to do okay hello camera well I wasn't get everything done that I want you that's all right it was still a good day the pigs are settling in nicely all the animals are doing great in the cold weather we're getting used to it too we're enjoying a nice fresh smoked bacon we have in the house all the great food we put up throughout the season now we get to sit back and enjoy that and just have fun thankful for the year great pigs and we're looking forward to the future thanks for liking commenting and subscribing I'll see you right back here tomorrow at Alumni egg there's a guide to modern homesteading self-sufficiency and freedom [Music] [Applause] [Music]
